overview_of_class: Using plays written after World War II, this course examines ways in which theatre holds "the mirror up to nature" (Shakespeare's Hamlet), capturing who we think we are, or who we might have been or may still become. Topics will include: political theatre, stylistic and social experimentation, postcolonial perspectives, and representations by previously marginalized groups like women, Africa-descended peoples, Middle Easterners, etc.
